boardgame.description: Carcassonne is a tile-placement game in which the players draw and place a tile with a piece of southern French landscape on it. The tile might feature a city, a road, a cloister, grassland or some combination thereof, and it must be placed adjacent to tiles that have already been played, in such a way that cities are connected to cities, roads to roads, etcetera. Having placed a tile, the player can then decide to place one of his meeples on one of the areas on it: on the city as a knight, on the road as a robber, on a cloister as a monk, or on the grass as a farmer. When that area is complete, that meeple scores points for its owner._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;During a game of Carcassonne, players are faced with decisions like: _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Is it really worth putting my last meeple there?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; or _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Should I use this tile to expand my city, or should I place it near my opponent instead, giving him a hard time to complete his project and score points?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; Since players place only one tile and have the option to place one meeple on it, turns proceed quickly even if it is a game full of options and possibilities._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;First game in the Carcassonne series._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Beschreibung_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Eine mittelalterliche Landschaft mit St_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;auml;dten und Kl_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ouml;stern, Stra_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;szlig;en und Wiesen. Mit Taktik und ihren Gefolgsleuten (Meeple) dehnen die Spieler in diesem raffinierten Legespiel ihren Einfluss auf die einzelnen Bereiche st_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;auml;ndig aus. Und das mit wachsender Begeisterung!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Carcassonne ist ein Legespiel, bei dem die Spieler verdeckt Landschaftspl_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;auml;ttchen ziehen und an die bestehende Landschaft passend anlegen m_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;uuml;ssen. Auf den Pl_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;auml;ttchen sind St_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;auml;dte, Stra_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;szlig;en, Kl_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ouml;ster und Grasland in verschiedenen Kombinationen dargestellt. Wenn dann das Pl_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;auml;ttchen passend angelegt wurde, darf der Spieler entscheiden, ob auf das gerade angelegte Pl_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;auml;ttchen ein Meeple als Ritter (in Stadt), Wegelagerer (auf Stra_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;szlig;e), M_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ouml;nch (in Kloster) oder Bauer (auf Wiese) eingesetzt werden soll, vor allem wenn es vielleicht gerade der letzte ist..._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Rio Grande Games (RIO 170) Type: Map building Number of players: 2 - 5 Age of players: 8+ Length: 60 minutes A clever tile-laying game. The southern French city of Carcassonne is famous for its unique Roman and Medieval fortifications. The players develop the area around Carcassonne and deploy their followers on the roads, in the cities, in the cloisters, and in the fields. The skill of the players to develop the area will determine who is victorious. Special rules for the 12 river tiles: Remove the special starting tile from the game. Instead, begin the game by laying the spring that starts the river. Set aside the lake tile and schuffle the remaining 10 river tiles face down and draw from these before drawing from the tiles from the normal game. These tiles are played and followers may be played as in the normal game with one exception: a river tile may not be placed so that the river makes a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;U_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; turn. Followers may not be placed on rivers. Once these 10 river tiles have been played, the next player plays the lake and then play continues with the normal tiles. Author: Klaus-Jürgen Wrede

Combined shipping works as follows for domestic (48 lower states) orders: Highest price shipping item: Full shipping cost 2nd-4th highest priced items: 50% off shipping cost for each of these items. 5th-10th highest priced shipping items: 60% off shipping costs for each of these items. 11th+ highest priced shipping items: 75% off shipping for all the rest of the items. As an example say you purchased 15 games, 3 of them with $10 shipping, 5 of them with $8 shipping and 7 of them with $4 shipping. The total shipping for the 15 items would be: Full shipping on the first item: $10.00 50% off shipping on items 2-4: $14.00 (50% off $10, $10 and $8, the next highest shipping cost items) 60% off shipping on items 5-10: $14.40 (60% off of 3 items at $8 shipping and 3 more items at $4 shipping = $36) 75% off shipping on items 11-15: $4.00 (75% off 4 items at $4) Total shipping on these 15 items then would be $10+$14+$14.40 + $4 = $42.40 shipping. This is just an example and your results will vary depending on what you buy of course!

Rio Grande Games (RIO 170) Type: Map building Number of players: 2 - 5 Age of players: 8+ Length: 60 minutes Game Description: A clever tile-laying game. The southern French city of Carcassonne is famous for its unique Roman and Medieval fortifications. The players develop the area around Carcassonne and deploy their followers on the roads, in the cities, in the cloisters, and in the fields. The skill of the players to develop the area will determine who is victorious. Special rules for the 12 river tiles: Remove the special starting tile from the game. Instead, begin the game by laying the spring that starts the river. Set aside the lake tile and schuffle the remaining 10 river tiles face down and draw from these before drawing from the tiles from the normal game. These tiles are played and followers may be played as in the normal game with one exception: a river tile may not be placed so that the river makes a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;U_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; turn. Followers may not be placed on rivers. Once these 10 river tiles have been played, the next player plays the lake and then play continues with the normal tiles.

Description: A clever tile-laying game. The southern French city of Carcassonne is famous for its unique Roman and Medieval fortifications. The players develop the area around Carcassonne and deploy their followers on the roads, in the cities, in the cloisters, and in the fields. The skill of the players to develop the area will determine who is victorious. Special rules for the 12 river tiles: Remove the special starting tile from the game. Instead, begin the game by laying the spring that starts the river. Set aside the lake tile and schuffle the remaining 10 river tiles face down and draw from these before drawing from the tiles from the normal game. These tiles are played and followers may be played as in the normal game with one exception: a river tile may not be placed so that the river makes a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;U_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; turn. Followers may not be placed on rivers. Once these 10 river tiles have been played, the next player plays the lake and then play continues with the normal tiles.
Components: 72 Land Tiles 40 Followers (8 × 5 Colors) 1 Scoring Track 1 Rule Booklet The River Expansion is now included with the Base Game (12 River Tiles)
